lead_paragraph: The professional golfer Tripp Isenhour pleaded no contest to charges that he killed a protected hawk in Orlando, Fla. His lawyer, David de Armas, said Isenhour agreed to a year of supervised probation, 4 hours of anger management classes and 100 hours of community service. Isenhour was charged with animal cruelty and killing a migratory bird; he was accused of hitting the bird with a golf shot after its chirps interrupted the filming of an instructional video.
